trans-unit.source: Describes a two-dimensional rectangle.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry"></xref> class, and creates a rectangle with zero area.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry"></xref> class and specifies its dimensions.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> structure with the rectangle's dimensions.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry"></xref> class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> structure with the rectangle's dimensions.
The radius of the rounded corner where it connects with the upper and lower edges of the rectangle.
The radius of the rounded corner where it connects with the left and right edges of the rectangle.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry"></xref> class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> structure with the rectangle's dimensions.
The radius of the rounded corner where it connects with the upper and lower edges of the rectangle.
The radius of the rounded corner where it connects with the left and right edges of the rectangle.
The transformation to apply to the geometry.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that specifies the bounding box of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry"></xref>.
This method does not take any pens into account.
If animations are present, the base values of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry> object are used to calculate the bounding box.
The bounding box of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry"></xref>.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
Gets the area of the filled region of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry"></xref> object.
The computational tolerance of error.
Specifies how the error tolerance will be interpreted.
The area of the filled region of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry"></xref> object.
Determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry"></xref> object is empty.
**true** if this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry"></xref> is empty; otherwise, **false**.
Determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry"></xref> object may have curved segments.
**true** if this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry"></xref> object may have curved segments; otherwise, **false**.
Gets or sets the x-radius of the ellipse use to round the corners of the rectangle.
For the rectangle to have rounded corners, both the <xref:System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry.RadiusX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry.RadiusY%2A> properties must be non-zero.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A value greater than or equal to zero and less than or equal to half the rectangle's width that describes the x-radius of the ellipse use to round the corners of the rectangle.
Values greater than half the rectangle's width are treated as though equal to half the rectangle's width.
Negative values are treated as positive values.
The default is 0.0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry.RadiusX"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the y-radius of the ellipse use to round the corners of the rectangle.
For the rectangle to have rounded corners, both the <xref:System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry.RadiusX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry.RadiusY%2A> properties must be non-zero.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A value greater than or equal to zero and less than or equal to half the rectangle's width that describes the y-radius of the ellipse use to round the corners of the rectangle.
Values greater than half the rectangle's width are treated as though equal to half the rectangle's width.
Negative values are treated as positive values.
The default is 0.0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry.RadiusY"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the dimensions of the rectangle.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The position and size of the rectangle.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Rect.Empty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RectangleGeometry.Rect"></xref> dependency property.
